page.title: 08Entertainment
page.content: The day after May Day the market arrived and the town was busy. A group of Majorettes dressed in stripey leotards paraded in Pocklington Market Place to tape recorded music. The fair came on May 31st. The speedway (Waltzers) was a fast ride it had nine cars on a platform which rotated and each car went round individually. There was another ride with wooden replica motorcycles on a platform that revolved. These rides cost 25 pence. The "Hook a Duck" was a children's game where plastic ducks floated on water and a small current moved them round. The child held a wooden rod with a hook on the end. If they could hook a duck they got prize which was a toy or a goldfish. On Monday 6th May a fun run was held to raise money for charity, they ran from Pocklington to Bishop Wilton and back.
